channel.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
channel.description:
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UVX0OUO9ptU[/url]
That shit is running on real time on a very powerful PC using hardware you can buy right now.
You can see that it is real-time in this video: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q9xhFpuIMX4[/url]
Real-time graphics basically indistinguishable from reality are a lot closer than we thought.

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Perhaps FF games can now have no prerendered cutscenes now then. Also Just Cause is made by these guys right, or a sub company of Square Enix? Maybe JC3 could be on this engine :retard: .

Read full topic

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo

item.description:

That video was showing off what their new engine can do.

I was legitimately asking.

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
item.dc:creator: Scorch6679
item.description:
So does tech demo mean “OUR GAME IS PRETTY AND OH YEAH ONLY WE CAN USE IT ANYWAYS. OUR ENGINE LOL.”
Or is there a better name for this that should have been used.

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
Yes, that is what I meant. I couldn’t bear to tell him – he’s my ex-boyfriend.

Read full topic

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

Most of the games that I have been seeing recently with such fine graphics have all been realistic and of similar styles. It would be interesting to see how one would implement a game of more artistic design into the realm of such graphics. For instance, it would be interesting to see how a game like Psychonauts or Warcraft would make use of such potential.

Maxey:

Half the charm of Psychonauts was made up of the bold art style it had, so realistic style would just not work for it.

As for Warcraft, it would just make it look generic.

When he said “make use of such potential”, I don’t think he meant anything about the style, just more along the lines of this:

xalener:

Psychonauts with high poly models and nicer shaders and bigger textures and identical designs would be pretty damn awesome though.

Which I totally agree with. A newer, better engine just means more tools to make a game look awesome, whether it has a realistic or stylized design.

Read full topic

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
I remember seeing a video posted on these forums that was about per-pixel motion blur – that was rather nice. I’d like to see that implemented into something if possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Honestly we’re just seeing the graphics we could’ve slowly moved into today if the industry wasn’t using the current generation of console hardware as the standard for engine development.

Read full topic

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
I always love it when they make really crappy demos of amazing technology. See also: Unreal 4 demo.

Anyway, this looks great, but if they want games to look anywhere near that, Sony and Microsoft had better pull their heads out of their asses.

Read full topic

item.title: Square-Enix's Luminous Engine tech demo
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
If they made an FF game with that modern-day feel it could really shake up series formula. They’d be one step closer to Xenogears.

Fuck that, they should remake Xenogears on that engine. With the full plot this time.
